# Gaussian Process Modeling {#gp-modeling}

Gaussian Processes (GP) are used for probabilistic modeling of unknown functions.  
Here is a simple example in R:

```{r}
# Load library
library(MASS)

# Example data
x <- seq(-5, 5, length.out = 20)
y <- sin(x) + rnorm(20, 0, 0.2)

# RBF Kernel function
rbf_kernel <- function(x1, x2, l=1){
  exp(- (outer(x1, x2, "-")^2) / (2*l^2))
}

K <- rbf_kernel(x, x) + 0.01 * diag(20)

# Simulate from the Gaussian Process
y_sim <- mvrnorm(1, mu = rep(0, 20), Sigma = K)

# Plot
plot(x, y, main="Gaussian Process Example", xlab="x", ylab="y")
lines(x, y_sim, col="blue")
```

#Space-Filling Design Example {#sfd-example}

Space-filling designs are used in computer experiments to explore the input space efficiently.
Here is a simple example using Latin Hypercube Sampling in R:


```{r}
# Load library
library(lhs)

# Create a 2D Latin Hypercube Design with 10 points
set.seed(123)
design <- randomLHS(10, 2)

#Scale to [0,1]
design_scaled <- design

# Plot design
plot(design_scaled, main="2D Latin Hypercube Design",
xlab="X1", ylab="X2", pch=19, col="red")
grid()
```
